title: I guess RIOT allows anything to be reportable
body:
So I guess everyone can just report for anything now a days huh? 

"In game 3 you went a bit overboard with calling others noobs and nerds." 

Like are you kidding me RIOT you can get reported for saying noob and nerd? like for real thats not even an offensive term. Hey but you know what riot, ill just do what you allow others to do. Ill just report everyone for any single word 
anyone says. Because apparently thats what you want a whole bunch of reports over nothing.

Good Job.




UPDATE: LOL are you kidding me. Welp ok ill do as you wish Ill report everyone for every single word. 

"We understand your desire to see justice taken in this matter. However, to protect the other player's personal information we will not be able to share with you any action taken on their account after this point. I would like to ensure you that we will be investigating and taking any action we feel is necessary, **so in the meantime please continue muting and reporting these players as this is the best way you can help us to track their behavior.**"

replies.body:
>Ill just report everyone for any single word anyone says. Because apparently thats what you want a whole bunch of reports over nothing.

Here's the thing: the system is set up in such a way that this is entirely okay. Any of your reports that don't meet the community's standards for toxicity will just get thrown out. It can't affect your report weight - _because that doesn't even exist any more._

If it _is_ a valid report, you've just helped clean up the community. Easy-peasy.

It's not that their word/phrase list is extreme -- it's how frequently you use those words and phrases.

If I call you a nerd once, that's one thing. If I spend 30 minutes calling you a nerd over and over and over, that's quite another.

I miss the old days of league, less trolls least in my games, less withering flowers because words which are now more injury inducing than physical things and not related but part if the equation, less overloaded champions and items like duskblade.

Can't even give advice in a comical manner anymore, smdh.

It's a complete joke now. Pretty sure sjw's and millennials (sad to say I'm one....) have completely taken over the company. There's a mute function for chat toxicity which is easily taken care of. But if you have a troll/feeder on your team, you're done for. Doesn't take a brain surgeon, or even a 1-year computer tech support guy, to figure out how to ban based on chat. All their chat looks for is key words and issues restrictions/bans. They don't have a clue how to filter out feeders or trolls.

If you want to be salty and spiteful, go ahread and report everyone. Just remember that over time your report will no longer mean anything, and you may face a ban for abusing the system.

Calling someone a noob or nerd once is fine, especially if you are joking,  just don't push it. I have a feeling that you indeed went a *little* overboard with your noob/nerd calling.

Normal if once or moderation(won't get you banned):
*just survives 2v1 gank by barely escaping through a sick outplay juke on LB*: "later nerds"
Not normal(the kind of thing that can very quickly get you punished): "F**king nerd loser, so trash get a life nerd".

Normal noob calling:
*just loses clown fiesta level 1 invade where every single player dies except for their vayne, the sole remaining player out of 10, who SOMEHOW secured a god damn penakill at level 1*:
"Damn we're all a bunch of noobs lol"

Punishment worthy reaction to that same scenario: "You all are total f**king noobs wow how did that happen you guys are so trash now vayne is going to eat us for breakfast, garbage noobs go uninstall bronzie filth".

You can use noob and nerd without being banned as long as you do so in heavy moderation, and usually jokingly. The word will not get you banned just from saying it jokingly once. It's how you use it and how often.

Also, would you mind posting logs so we can see for ourselves?

Your first part, with the report weight. That doesn't exist anymore. Automated system flags every game someone reports. Doesn't matter if someone gives 99 bad reports, if on the 100th it is a legit report, it still gets used.
I can find like 20 times where a Rioter referenced that it DOES exist within the past month.

Would you be kind and show us one of those twenty cases for future reference? Thank you.

I haven't seen that kind of claim and I tend to read these boards a lot. Instead, I have seen this: [Tantram](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/4ZhxeyVg-where-can-i-make-two-players-banned?comment=00020000000200000001)

While I *could* dig through all of them, I don't think I need to; and this is why. On the Riot support website, updated *very* recently (late July, much more recent than that Tamtram post):

>"WILL MY ACCOUNT GET PUNISHED FOR BEING REPORTED WHEN I DID NOTHING WRONG?
This is unlikely, as reports are only one piece of the puzzle. While they are important to bringing games to our attention the system still gauges the behavior in game before punishments are issued. *Also, players who consistently make false reports against others diminishes the value of that player's report and renders them meaningless."*

Your move.

Thank you for the answer. It seems that either the Rioter who wrote that is unaware that report weight does not exists, or that things have changed since Tantram wrote the thing I linked. It seems that we need to get clarification about that matter from a Rioter, so I guess I will attempt to get one. [Here.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/1vUGoiuQ-riot-report-weigth-does-it-exist-or-not) Of course I won't hold my breath while we wait for Riot's response, but we might get one, maybe.
